intro: Adinandra rantepaoensis, commonly known as the Rantepao tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are white or pale yellow with five petals. The Rantepao tree is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
